sen.j: 喜多流（きたりゅう）とは、日本の伝統芸能である能楽のうち、能のシテ方の流派である。
sen.e: The Kita school is one of the shite-kata (actors who play leading characters) schools of Noh in Nohgaku (the art of Noh), which is one of the Japanese traditional performance arts.
The Kita school is one of the shite-kata (actors who play leading characters) schools of Noh in Nohgaku (the art of Noh), which is one of the Japanese traditional performance arts.
The Kita school is one of the shite-kata (actors who play leading characters) schools of Noh in Nohgaku (the art of Noh), which is one of the Japanese traditional performance arts.
Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 江戸時代初期に興った新興流派で、金剛流の流れを汲む。
sen.e: This school appeared in the beginning of the Edo period, and they were descended from the Kongo school.
This school appeared in the beginning of the Edo period, and they were descended from the Kongo school.
This school appeared in the beginning of the Edo period, and they were descended from the Kongo school.

sen.j: 流派の祖は徳川秀忠に愛好された喜多七太夫。
sen.e: Shichidayu KITA, who was a favorite actor of Hidetada TOKUGAWA, founded this school.
Shichidayu KITA, who was a favorite actor of Hidetada TOKUGAWA, founded this school.
Shichidayu KITA, who was a favorite actor of Hidetada TOKUGAWA, founded this school.

sen.j: 七太夫は金剛太夫（金剛流の家元）弥一の養子となり金剛太夫を継承したが、弥一の実子・右京勝吉の成人後に太夫の地位を譲った。
sen.e: Shichidayu was adopted by Yaichi, who was the tayu (headmaster) of the Kongo school, and he succeeded to the position of the headmaster of the Kongo school, but he handed over the position of the tayu to Shokichi (also called Ukyo), who was a biological son of Yaichi, after Shokichi came of age.
sen.cmt: 「右京勝吉」とありますが「右京」は名字ではなく勝吉の通称であるため、そのように訳出いたしました。
sen.e: Shichidayu was adopted by Yaichi, who was the tayu (headmaster) of the Kongo school, and he succeeded to the position of the headmaster of the Kongo school, but he handed over the position of the tayu to Shokichi (also called Ukyo), who was a biological son of Yaichi, after Shokichi came of age.

Shichidayu was adopted by Yaichi, who was the tayu (headmaster) of the Kongo school, and he succeeded to the position of the headmaster of the Kongo school, but he handed over the position of the tayu to Shokichi (also called Ukyo), who was a biological son of Yaichi, after Shokichi came of age.

sen.j: その後、徳川秀忠、徳川家光の後援を受けて元和 (日本)年間に喜多流の創設を認められ、喜多流は四座の次に位置する立場となった。
sen.e: Subsequently, he was allowed to establish the Kita school backed up by Hidetada TOKUGAWA and Iemitsu TOKUGAWA in the Genna era, and the school ranked next to the yoza (literally, 'four schools,' representing major four noh schools: the Kanze school, the Hosho school, the Kongo school, and the Konparu school).
sen.cmt: 原文に「元和 (日本)」とありますがリンク先の用語と混ざっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「元和」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: Subsequently, he was allowed to establish the Kita school backed up by Hidetada TOKUGAWA and Iemitsu TOKUGAWA in the Genna era, and the school ranked next to the yoza (literally, 'four schools,' representing major four noh schools: the Kanze school, the Hosho school, the Kongo school, and the Konparu school).

Subsequently, he was allowed to establish the Kita school backed up by Hidetada TOKUGAWA and Iemitsu TOKUGAWA in the Genna era, and the school ranked next to the yoza (literally, 'four schools,' representing major four noh schools: the Kanze school, the Hosho school, the Kongo school, and the Konparu school).

sen.j: 現在、五流の内では最も規模の小さい流派である。
sen.e: They are currently the smallest school among these five schools.
They are currently the smallest school among these five schools.
They are currently the smallest school among these five schools.

sen.j: 武士気質で素朴かつ豪放な芸風で、大名（津軽藩、仙台藩、水戸藩、彦根藩（井伊氏）、紀州藩、広島藩、松山藩、福岡藩、熊本藩（細川氏）等）にも採用された。
sen.e: Their performance style was described as "samurai-fashioned," "simple," and "dynamic," and their style was adopted by daimyo (Japanese feudal lords) in many domains such as the Tsugaru Domain, the Sendai Domain, the Mito Domain, the Hikone Domain (the Ii family), the Kishu Domain, the Hiroshima Domain, the Matsuyama Domain, the Fukuoka Domain, and the Kumamoto Domain (the Hosokawa family).
sen.cmt: 原文に「井伊氏」「細川氏」とありますが、リンク先の用語と混ざっているようです。ウェブを確認し、それぞれ「井伊家」「細川家」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: Their performance style was described as "samurai-fashioned," "simple," and "dynamic," and their style was adopted by daimyo (Japanese feudal lords) in many domains such as the Tsugaru Domain, the Sendai Domain, the Mito Domain, the Hikone Domain (the Ii family), the Kishu Domain, the Hiroshima Domain, the Matsuyama Domain, the Fukuoka Domain, and the Kumamoto Domain (the Hosokawa family).

Their performance style was described as "samurai-fashioned," "simple," and "dynamic," and their style was adopted by daimyo (Japanese feudal lords) in many domains such as the Tsugaru Domain, the Sendai Domain, the Mito Domain, the Hikone Domain (the Ii family), the Kishu Domain, the Hiroshima Domain, the Matsuyama Domain, the Fukuoka Domain, and the Kumamoto Domain (the Hosokawa family).

sen.j: 徳川幕府瓦解後、一時は廃絶の危機に瀕するが、喜多六平太 (14世)という名人が登場し、流派は生きながらえた。
sen.e: After the Tokugawa shogunate was collapsed, the school faced with the threat of extinction for a while, but the school eventually survived because of a great performer named Roppeita KITA (the 14th generation), who appeared during the crisis.

After the Tokugawa shogunate was collapsed, the school faced with the threat of extinction for a while, but the school eventually survived because of a great performer named Roppeita KITA (the 14th generation), who appeared during the crisis.

After the Tokugawa shogunate was collapsed, the school faced with the threat of extinction for a while, but the school eventually survived because of a great performer named Roppeita KITA (the 14th generation), who appeared during the crisis.

sen.j: また浅野家、井伊家、藤堂家、山内家等の旧藩主の協力や、喜多流に属する地方の能楽師たちも流派の存続に尽力した。
sen.e: Former feudal lords from the Asano family, the Ii family, the Todo family, and the Yamauchi family also supported the school, and other local Noh actors of the Kita school made efforts to maintain the school.

Former feudal lords from the Asano family, the Ii family, the Todo family, and the Yamauchi family also supported the school, and other local Noh actors of the Kita school made efforts to maintain the school.

Former feudal lords from the Asano family, the Ii family, the Todo family, and the Yamauchi family also supported the school, and other local Noh actors of the Kita school made efforts to maintain the school.

sen.j: 大正・昭和期の名人として喜多実、後藤得三ついで友枝喜久夫・友枝昭世親子、粟谷菊生、塩津哲生らが知られている。
sen.e: Minoru KITA, Tokuzo GOTO were great actors of this school of the Taisho and the Showa periods, and after them, other masters such as Kikuo TOMOEDA, Akiyo TOMOEDA (Kikuo and Akiyo are father and son), Kikuo AWAYA, and Akio SHIOTSU appeared from this school.

Minoru KITA, Tokuzo GOTO were great actors of this school of the Taisho and the Showa periods, and after them, other masters such as Kikuo TOMOEDA, Akiyo TOMOEDA (Kikuo and Akiyo are father and son), Kikuo AWAYA, and Akio SHIOTSU appeared from this school.

Minoru KITA, Tokuzo GOTO were great actors of this school of the Taisho and the Showa periods, and after them, other masters such as Kikuo TOMOEDA, Akiyo TOMOEDA (Kikuo and Akiyo are father and son), Kikuo AWAYA, and Akio SHIOTSU appeared from this school.
Internal troubles
Internal troubles
Internal troubles

sen.j: 現宗家は喜多六平太 (16世)であるが、現在喜多流は職分会が宗家と絶縁状態にある。
sen.e: The Kita school, whose current headman is Roppeita KITA (the 16th generation), is currently disconnected with the school's shokubunkai (group of school members who are not from the head family).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Kita school, whose current headman is Roppeita KITA (the 16th generation), is currently disconnected with the school's shokubunkai (gathering of a school's occupational branch family).
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。(group of school members who are not from the head family) → (gathering of a school's occupational branch family)
sen.e: The Kita school, whose current headman is Roppeita KITA (the 16th generation), is currently disconnected with the school's shokubunkai (gathering of a school's occupational branch family).

sen.j: 職分会は1998年より宗家主宰の喜多会を離れて喜多流職分会として活動している。
sen.e: The shokubunkai has called themselves Kita-ryu Shokubunkai and developed their own activities separately from the Kitakai (literally, "Kita group"), which is operated by the head family, since 1998.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The shokubunkai has called themselves Kita-ryu Shokubunkai and developed their own activities separately from the Kitakai (literally, "Kita group"), which is operated by the head family, since 1998.
The shokubunkai has called themselves Kita-ryu Shokubunkai and developed their own activities separately from the Kitakai (literally, "Kita group"), which is operated by the head family, since 1998.

sen.j: また宗家は先代の遺産分割を巡って訴訟が発生し、1審、2審では装束や面などを売却してその代金を遺族で分割するとの判決が出た。
sen.e: Additionally, the head family ended up in court for a conflict over apportionment of the property left by the previous headman, and they were sentenced to sell inherited costumes and masks and apportion the proceeds of the sale among the family members of the deceased at the first and the second trials.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Additionally, the head family ended up in court for a conflict over apportionment of the property left by the previous headman, and they were sentenced to sell inherited costumes and masks and apportion the proceeds of the sale among the family members of the deceased at the first and the second trials.

Additionally, the head family ended up in court for a conflict over apportionment of the property left by the previous headman, and they were sentenced to sell inherited costumes and masks and apportion the proceeds of the sale among the family members of the deceased at the first and the second trials.

sen.j: 2006年の上告審判決では、これらの金銭的価値を見積もった上での現物分与が命じられた。
sen.e: In 2006, they were sentenced to apportion actual articles among the family members based on estimated values of these articles at the Supreme Court.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 2006, they were sentenced to apportion actual articles among the family members based on estimated values of these articles at the Supreme Court.
